hed: 10 Outstanding Menswear Brands You Won’t Find in a Department Store
dek: It’s never been easy to be a young designer. Competing with mass-market heavyweights on price, or with luxury brands on quality, has always been a tricky thing. In 2015, it’s even harder—shoppers have been trained to think only in those extremes. They either want buzzy prestige (hel-lo [Hermès Apple Watch](http://www.gq.com/story/apple-announces-new-apple-watch-with-hermes)) or trends at bargain-basement prices (we see you, [Primark](http://www.gq.com/story/primark-opens-in-us))—unless, well, *unless* a brand finds a way to pull at their heartstrings. When that happens, all bets are off. And that’s where those young designers come in. A whole slew of them have decided to sell straight to shoppers (no department stores, no boutiques) in order to keep their costs down, their quality up, and their message clear. It’s a 2015 triple threat—and your fall wardrobe is about to reap the benefits.

items.title: The Arrivals
items.caption:
Next-level jackets for every possible type of person. So. Damn. Good. 

*Visit: [thearrivals.com](https://thearrivals.com/)*

items.title: Leonard and Church
items.caption:
Classic, crowd-pleasing watches with wristbands that’ll set you apart. 

*Visit: [leonardandchurch.com](http://leonardandchurch.com/)*

items.title: DSTLD
items.caption:
Selvedge jeans and luxe basics with a vague L.A. vibe (but, you know, in a good way). 

*Visit: [dstldjeans.com](https://www.dstldjeans.com/)*

items.title: Victor Athletics
items.caption:
Organic sweats that feel like they’re straight out of the ‘70s, but cut for today. 

*Visit: [victorathletics.com](http://victorathletics.com/)*

items.title: Warby Parker
items.caption:
The OGs of the direct-to-consumer game, specializing in eyewear that gives back. 

*Visit: [warbyparker.com](https://www.warbyparker.com/)*

items.title: Outdoor Voices
items.caption:
Pared-down athletic gear for working out—or just thinking about it.  

*Visit: [outdoorvoices.com](http://www.outdoorvoices.com/)*

items.title: Jack Erwin
items.caption:
Expertly crafted shoes for the guy who wants (or needs) to look profesh at all times. 

*Visit: [jackerwin.com](http://www.jackerwin.com/)*

items.title: Everlane
items.caption:
Tasteful, minimalist basics for every (and we mean every) section of your wardrobe. 

*Visit: [everlane.com](https://www.everlane.com/)*

items.title: Proper Cloth
items.caption:
Custom dress shirts for work and looking generally spiffy. Great furnishings, too. 

*Visit: [propercloth.com](http://propercloth.com/)*

items.title: Isaora
items.caption:
Slick performance clothing for athletes and urbanites alike. 

*Visit: [isaora.com](https://www.isaora.com/)*
